Gasoline prices bumped up the US inflation reading in August ahead of policymakers key interest rate decision

Consumer inflation in the United States rose for a second straight month in August the government reported Wednesday putting the heat on policymakers as they work to lower prices PERIOD

The consumer price index CPI a key inflation gauge jumped . percent from a year ago picking up pace from Julys . percent figure said the Labor Department PERIOD

But a measurement stripping out volatile segments cooled to its slowest rate since September  PERIOD

All eyes are on the report which is expected to have a bearing on the US central banks interest rate decision due next week PERIOD

The Federal Reserve has lifted the benchmark lending rate rapidly since March last year to tamp down demand and sustainably lower inflation  but the current figure remains stubbornly above officials two percent goal PERIOD

In August higher gasoline costs bumped up headline inflation but the socalled core reading  removing the volatile food and energy components  cooled to . percent on an annual basis PERIOD
